holidays.name: International Day of Happiness
holidays.description: A global celebration encouraging people to recognize and pursue happiness as a fundamental human goal.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2012 to promote the importance of happiness and well-being worldwide.
holidays.funFact: The date was chosen to coincide with the March Equinox, symbolizing balance and harmonyâ€”key ingredients for happiness!

holidays.name: World Storytelling Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the art of storytelling by sharing tales and legends across cultures.
holidays.origin: Created in 1997 by a group of storytellers in Sweden to promote storytelling as a rich tradition.
holidays.funFact: Worldwide events on this day often feature stories themed around 'Bridges' connecting people and ideas.

holidays.name: Sparkle Day
holidays.description: An unofficial holiday where people embrace all things shiny, sparkly, and glittery to brighten the day.
holidays.origin: Begun by creative communities online who wanted a mid-March pick-me-up full of glitter and glam.
holidays.funFact: On Sparkle Day, some people wear glitter not just on their clothes but even in their hair and on their faces!

holidays.name: National Ravioli Day (USA)
holidays.description: A delicious food holiday dedicated to enjoying the classic stuffed pastaâ€”ravioli!
holidays.origin: Unclear, but beloved in Italian-American communities as a celebration of comfort food.
holidays.funFact: Many Italian grandmothers have their own secret ravioli fillings passed down through generations, making this day perfect for family recipes!
